While terrified out of his shell, Rat Trap knew that he'd have to settle fo=
r peaking out rather than actually coming out of where he was hidden.  He q=
uickly recedes back into his tiny hole.  Perceptor was not far from him, an=
d there was no way in the universe he was going to allow himself to be caug=
ht by the blind Predacon.  He sniffs around and finds a tiny breeze blowing=
 through a vent hole.  With rodent like instinct he follows it and gets him=
self into a tight spot, only large enough for him to pass through.  When in=
 doubt stick to tight places and there's a good chance you'll remain safe. =
 It was how Rat Trap survived countless encounters with predacons twice his=
 size. The transmitter remains the same. No changes since the last time it =
gradually picked up a slightly faster pace.  

"Gotta - make it outa here n=
o matter what.  Wheels needs me, I can't just drop 'em like a pile of scrap=
, I can't.  He's probably the only friend I got other than my comrades.   A=
nd besides, he's leader material, and if anyone can give glory back ta the =
Autobots, it's him.  Forget about Rodimus steppn' up ta the plate, he's far=
 too gone now.  And I wonder, I wonder what would happen if Tucson was able=
 ta break the hold on Roddie, what will everyone think of him once he came =
clean again?  I sure know what I'd think.. I'd think he's yesterday's news.=
  Trust him again, yeah, right, over my dead aft I'll trust that guy again.=
  Fancy paint job or no fancy paint job, he ain't no Optimus Prime like Whe=
els."

Thought Rat Trap as he quietly and slowly makes his way through the =
vent pipes of the base.  

Back at the torturing device...

A little off li=
ne time gives Tucson a small window of energy recovery, as he simply gains =
back consciousness only to find himself bound to a torture device, just by =
the feel of things.  He had no strength to bust out, and his sonar system w=
hich gave him much of his ability to jam signals and send emp disruptor wav=
es was now in Rat Traps possession, on his own will.  The very device he kn=
ew, was the only key to finding the ark, for him anyway.   Other than havin=
g that device to cue him on his direction, he had no other knowledge of whe=
re the Ark had landed.  

" Oh - well, sooner - or later I - was bound to -=
 get caught. "

He sighs and gives no indication of fear or anxiety.  He wa=
s confident in Rat Trap's ability to find help, and knew deep down that his=
 little friend would not disappoint him.  He was not about to let onto any =
of his strategies, and the fact that he had given up the one tool that woul=
d help his enemy find the Ark.  

" Uh ohh, I - think I lost my sonar trans=
mitter someplace..  Hmm, must have gotten destroyed in the heat of the figh=
t.  Too bad, because that was - the only link I had to the - Ark.  Being si=
ght impaired finding my way is next to - near impossible.  Wow, you - sure =
got me good this time. How unfortunate... All that power, lost in an unknow=
n area of this planet, with no way of locating it.  I'm sorry, but without =
that device, I can not find the Ark let alone see anything in front of my f=
ace."

He gave up the information he knew he could give to them safely.  Th=
e rest he keeps quiet.

> Tucson had no energy left to fight b=
ack. He could hardly feel Dark Hawk pounding on him, as he now goes off lin=
e and offers no resistance to his enemy's wrath. Not one sound from him as =
this happens. He lands on his side, and remains still. His only hope now wa=
s that Rat Trap could get to the Ark. 
> 
> Trying to get away from the int=
ernal defenses proves difficult to Rat Trap. With the droids hot on his tai=
l literally, he struggles to scamper out of his predicament.
> 
> " This is=
 it, I'm a dead rat! I'm a dead rat! I'M A DEAD RAT! GAHHHH!!!"
> 
> Out of=
 sheer panic he slides into a slip hole into a vent shaft. It proves dark a=
nd tight, just big enough for a rat to fit in. He stays there to catch his =
breath.
> 
> " Sorry Wheels... I ran into a major set back.. Maaaaan talk a=
bout a mouse trap." 
> 
> The transmitter given to him, begins to pulse. Ju=
st a slight faster than before. Yet still very far away from his destinatio=
n, Rat Trap looks to it, and listens to it.
> 
> " The transmitter.. It's -=
 got somethn'. Kinda faint but a little bit faster than before.. Which way =
now?"
> 
> With so many droids roaming the halls, it would prove impossible=
 for Rat Trap to continue his journey unseen. He thinks to himself.
> 
> " =
If I sit here I ain't never gonna get ta the Ark. And if I don't get ta the=
 ark, those preds'n cons are gonna exploit it for their own personal gain. =
And it looks like Tucson's the key ta gettn' what they want. No, I can't ju=
st sit here, he's count'n on me. Dead rat or no dead Rat, I gotta do this."=

> 
> Slowly and cautiously he ventures out of his hole.
>

Tucson reels in pain, and then realizes that Nightlight is not responding t=

on gasps for breath. He then takes off his transmitter from his helmet and =

> > " I can't go anywhere anyway. Now, get - going. You have a lot of groun=

onto his left ear, while in his rat form. The transmitter seems rather larg=

me Wheels."
> >

hallways in his rat form, cautiously moving and freezing in place once in o=
pen areas. The transmitter blips slowly. He still had a long way to go befo=
